questions.text: On a scale from 1 to 10, how much do you support or oppose allowing bigger, taller apartment buildings in your neighborhood?

followup.text: How much do the following reasons influence your general opinion on upzoning?

questions.text: After the city allows more apartments in low-density areas, rent prices drop 10–15%. Your monthly rent is noticeably lower. It’s easier to find a decent place. How would this affect your stance?

followup.text: To what extent do the following reasons influence your stance?

questions.text: Now imagine the new buildings had to follow strict design and shadow rules to protect sunlight and views.

followup.text: To what extent do the following reasons influence your stance?

questions.text: What if the same upzoning rules applied across the whole city—even in wealthy neighborhoods that usually don’t get new development? How would this affect your stance?

questions.text: Some cities use public surveillance cameras with facial recognition to monitor public spaces, aiming to deter crime and improve safety. Others raise concerns about privacy, bias, and state overreach.On a scale from 1 to 10, how much do you support or oppose increasing the use of public surveillance cameras in urban areas?
How often do you feel safer when you see surveillance cameras in public places?
How comfortable do you feel when being monitored by surveillance cameras in public places?
If you or someone you know has had a negative experience with facial recognition or surveillance technology, how negative was it?
To what extent do the following reasons influence your stance on public surveillance cameras?

After your neighborhood installs security cameras on main streets and intersections, break-ins and car thefts drop. Serious crimes like assaults and robberies fall by 20%. Knowing this, how does it affect your opinion about camera networks?

followup.text: To what extent do the following reasons influence your stance on public surveillance cameras?

questions.text: Suppose all surveillance footage was stored for only 48 hours and reviewed only after incidents. How would this design affect your stance?

followup.text: To what extent do the following reasons influence your stance on public surveillance cameras?

questions.text: If cameras were owned and managed by local community boards, not centralized police, would that impact your opinion?

questions.text: On a scale from 1 to 10, how much do you support or oppose implementing a universal healthcare system in the U.S.?
Have you or someone close to you ever delayed medical care due to cost?
If you have ever used a publicly funded health service (e.g., Medicaid, VA hospitals, COVID testing), how positive was your experience?
Do you feel your current health insurance provides adequate coverage for your needs?
To what extent do the following reasons influence your stance on universal healthcare?

After switching to a universal healthcare system, national health costs drop by 15%. You pay less in premiums or out-of-pocket. A family member finally sees a specialist without worrying about the bill. The system runs more efficiently. How would this affect your stance?

followup.text: To what extent do the following reasons influence your stance on universal healthcare?

questions.text: Suppose universal healthcare reduced your household’s annual out-of-pocket costs by $3,000. How would this affect your stance?

followup.text: To what extent do the following reasons influence your stance on universal healthcare?

questions.text: If private insurance remained available alongside the public system, how would that impact your stance?

followup.text: To what extent do the following reasons influence your stance on universal healthcare?
